eg.console

Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.console.Console

  • public class Console
extends java.lang.Object
    The console for showing messages and for running system processes. System commands are run by this ProcessStarter and their output is displayed in the same text area that this print methods write to.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Console(ConsolePanel consPnl, java.lang.Runnable fileTreeUpdate) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canPrint()
      Returns the boolean that, if true, indicates that the console is writable.
      void clear()
      Clears the console
      void print(java.lang.String text)
      Prints the specified text without appending a line separator
      void printBr(java.lang.String text)
      Prints a message which will be formatted such that it is bordered by double angle brackets and a the line separator is appended.
      ProcessStarter processStarter()
      Gets this ProcessStarter
      void toTop()
      Jumps to the beginning of the console

        public Console(ConsolePanel consPnl,

    • Method Detail

      • processStarter

        public ProcessStarter processStarter()
        Gets this ProcessStarter
        Returns:
        this ProcessStarter

      • canPrint

        public boolean canPrint()
        Returns the boolean that, if true, indicates that the console is writable. False indicates that a process started in this ProcessStarter currently uses the console. A warning dialog is shown in this case.
        Returns:
        the boolean value

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the console
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the console is currently used by a process run in this ProcessStarter

      • print

        public void print(java.lang.String text)
        Prints the specified text without appending a line separator
        Parameters:
        text - the text
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the console is currently used by a process run in this ProcessStarter

      • printBr

        public void printBr(java.lang.String text)
        Prints a message which will be formatted such that it is bordered by double angle brackets and a the line separator is appended. This output is intended for predefined status messages.
        Parameters:
        text - the message
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the console is currently used by a process run in this ProcessStarter

      • toTop

        public void toTop()
        Jumps to the beginning of the console
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the console is currently used by a process run in this ProcessStarter
